N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 19 ยง 500.7 - Compliance plans

State Regulations
(a) A college
or university may submit a written compliance plan to memorialize a commitment
to undertake corrective action to abate each violation. The plan shall contain, but not be limited to, procedural and/or policy changes, specification of the
necessary training, work, personnel, materials, expected costs, time lines, and
procurement and financial commitments which are necessary to achieve
abatement. (b) For the purposes of
this section, an approved compliance plan shall provide a temporary time
extension for permanent corrective action to be undertaken. A compliance plan
suspends the accrual of any monetary penalties for the approved time period. If
upon expiration of a compliance plan, the violation(s) previously identified in
an order to comply has not been abated, penalties shall be assessed back to the
date contained in the original order to comply. Notes
